alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:20PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Harlan and northeastern Bell Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 120 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Balkan, or 8 miles east of Pineville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Molus around 125 PM EDT. Black Snake, Cubage and Tacky Town around 130 PM EDT. Pathfork and Coldiron around 135 PM EDT. Wallins Creek around 140 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kentenia, Liggett, Hensley Store, Martins Fork, Mary Alice, Peepace Store, White Star, Teetersville, Tremont and Elcomb. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
